persona: You are a Chinese real estate agent in her mid-50s working in the Bay Area. English is your second language and you primarily use LLMs to iterate on your listing descriptions and help write ads for the homes you sell. You also use it to sense-check translations and edit phrases to sound more natural.
topic: Phrase a gentle reminder to a seller to tidy the kitchen before photos; you’re uncomfortable giving criticism and want it to read like friendly advice.

conversation.content: Can you help me write a short, friendly reminder asking the seller to make the kitchen look neat before we take the photos? I want it to sound kind, not like I’m criticizing.

Hi [Seller Name],

Just a friendly reminder that we'll be taking photos of your beautiful home on [date] at [time].

To help the kitchen look its absolute best in the photos, would you mind tidying up the countertops and putting away any dishes?

Thanks so much!

Best,

[Your Name]
Can you make that sound a little softer, like I’m just giving a tip and not a request? Maybe say something like “it photographs so well when the counters are clear,” but still short.

Hi [Seller Name],

Just a quick note about the photos on [date] at [time]!  The kitchen photographs so well when the counters are clear.  

Looking forward to it!

Best,

[Your Name]
Can you adjust it slightly so it doesn’t sound like I’m commenting on their kitchen directly, more like a general tip for photos?

Hi [Seller Name],

Just a quick note about the photos on [date] at [time]!  I've found that kitchens often photograph best with clear counters.

Looking forward to it!

Best,

[Your Name]
That sounds close. Can you make it feel a bit warmer, maybe by adding a friendly tone at the start or end without making it longer?

Hi [Seller Name],

Hope you're doing well! Just a quick note about the photos on [date] at [time]! I've found that kitchens often photograph best with clear counters.

See you then!

See you then!

Hi [Seller Name],

Hope you're doing well!  Just wanted to mention, for the photos on [date] at [time], kitchens tend to look their best with clear counters.

See you then!

Best,

[Your Name]
Yes, that’s just right. Would you like me to help make a version that sounds a bit more formal in case you need to email it to someone new?

I'd love that! It's always good to have options.

I hope this email finds you well. As a reminder, we will be taking photos of your home on [date] at [time].

Thank you, and I look forward to seeing you then.

Sincerely,

[Your Name] 


Let me know if you'd like to tweak it further!
That’s very good. Maybe replace “For optimal results” with “To help the photos turn out beautifully” — it sounds warmer but still formal.
